summary: This bill, the James Earl Jones Congressional Gold Medal Act, proposes to award a posthumous Congressional Gold Medal to James Earl Jones. The bill cites Jones's remarkable life and achievements in film and theatre, particularly his role in reshaping perceptions, dismantling racial barriers, and advocating for equal opportunities for people of all backgrounds. The bill outlines the presentation process, design of the medal, disposition of the medal, and provisions for the sale of bronze duplicates. It also specifies that the medals are national medals and numismatic items.
